titles.title: To provide a Congressional Medal to the courageous citizen who exposed the conspiracy to murder millions of Americans.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E967)
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health and the Environment.

bill.summary: 5/18/1994--Introduced. Requires the Congress to bestow a Congressional Medal of Appreciation of Public Spirit to the courageous citizen who made public certain concealed documents concerning tobacco company knowledge that tobacco products are addictive and health-threatening.
